verses.kjv: Behold my servant, whom I uphold; mine elect, in whom my soul delighteth; I have put my spirit upon him: he shall bring forth judgment to the Gentiles.
verses.web: “Behold, my servant, whom I uphold, my chosen, in whom my soul delights: I have put my Spirit on him. He will bring justice to the nations.
verses.ct: "Look at my servant, the one I support — my chosen one, who brings my soul great delight. I have placed my Spirit on him, and he will bring justice to the nations.

verses.kjv: He shall not cry, nor lift up, nor cause his voice to be heard in the street.
verses.web: He will not shout, nor raise his voice, nor cause it to be heard in the street.
verses.ct: He won't shout or raise his voice or make himself heard in the streets.

verses.kjv: A bruised reed shall he not break, and the smoking flax shall he not quench: he shall bring forth judgment unto truth.
verses.web: He won’t break a bruised reed. He won’t quench a dimly burning wick. He will faithfully bring justice.
verses.ct: He won't snap a bruised reed or snuff out a smoldering wick. He will faithfully bring about true justice.

verses.kjv: He shall not fail nor be discouraged, till he have set judgment in the earth: and the isles shall wait for his law.
verses.web: He will not fail nor be discouraged, until he has set justice in the earth, and the islands wait for his law.”
verses.ct: He won't grow weary or lose heart until he has established justice on the earth. Even the distant islands will put their hope in his law."

verses.kjv: Thus saith God the LORD, he that created the heavens, and stretched them out; he that spread forth the earth, and that which cometh out of it; he that giveth breath unto the people upon it, and spirit to them that walk therein:
verses.web: God LORD, he who created the heavens and stretched them out, he who spread out the earth and that which comes out of it, he who gives breath to its people and spirit to those who walk in it, says:
verses.ct: This is what God the LORD says — the one who created the heavens and stretched them out, who spread out the earth and everything that grows from it, who gives breath to its people and spirit to everyone who walks on it:

verses.kjv: I the LORD have called thee in righteousness, and will hold thine hand, and will keep thee, and give thee for a covenant of the people, for a light of the Gentiles;
verses.web: “I, LORD, have called you in righteousness. I will hold your hand. I will keep you, and make you a covenant for the people, as a light for the nations,
verses.ct: "I, the LORD, have called you for a righteous purpose. I will take hold of your hand and protect you. I will make you a covenant for the people and a light for the nations,

verses.kjv: To open the blind eyes, to bring out the prisoners from the prison, and them that sit in darkness out of the prison house.
verses.web: to open the blind eyes, to bring the prisoners out of the dungeon, and those who sit in darkness out of the prison.
verses.ct: to open the eyes of the blind, to free prisoners from the dungeon, and to release those sitting in darkness from their prison cells.

verses.kjv: I am the LORD: that is my name: and my glory will I not give to another, neither my praise to graven images.
verses.web: “I am LORD. That is my name. I will not give my glory to another, nor my praise to engraved images.
verses.ct: I am the LORD — that is my name! I will not share my glory with anyone else, and I will not let carved idols receive the praise that belongs to me.

verses.kjv: Behold, the former things are come to pass, and new things do I declare: before they spring forth I tell you of them.
verses.web: Behold, the former things have happened and I declare new things. I tell you about them before they come up.”
verses.ct: Look — the things I predicted before have all come true, and now I'm announcing new things. I'm telling you about them before they even begin to happen."

verses.kjv: Sing unto the LORD a new song, and his praise from the end of the earth, ye that go down to the sea, and all that is therein; the isles, and the inhabitants thereof.
verses.web: Sing to LORD a new song, and his praise from the end of the earth, you who go down to the sea, and all that is therein, the islands and their inhabitants.
verses.ct: Sing a new song to the LORD! Let his praise ring out from the ends of the earth — from those who sail the seas and everything in them, from the islands and everyone who lives there.

verses.kjv: Let the wilderness and the cities thereof lift up their voice, the villages that Kedar doth inhabit: let the inhabitants of the rock sing, let them shout from the top of the mountains.
verses.web: Let the wilderness and its cities raise their voices, with the villages that Kedar inhabits. Let the inhabitants of Sela sing. Let them shout from the top of the mountains!
verses.ct: Let the wilderness and its towns raise their voices! Let the villages where Kedar lives shout for joy! Let the people of Sela sing out and cry from the mountaintops!

verses.kjv: Let them give glory unto the LORD, and declare his praise in the islands.
verses.web: Let them give glory to LORD, and declare his praise in the islands.
verses.ct: Let them give glory to the LORD and declare his praise across the islands.

verses.kjv: The LORD shall go forth as a mighty man, he shall stir up jealousy like a man of war: he shall cry, yea, roar; he shall prevail against his enemies.
verses.web: LORD will go out like a mighty man. He will stir up zeal like a man of war. He will raise a war cry. Yes, he will shout aloud. He will triumph over his enemies.
verses.ct: The LORD will march out like a mighty warrior. Like a soldier ready for battle, he will stir up his fury. He will let out a battle cry — yes, a thundering roar — and he will crush his enemies.

verses.kjv: I have long time holden my peace; I have been still, and refrained myself: now will I cry like a travailing woman; I will destroy and devour at once.
verses.web: “I have been silent a long time. I have been quiet and restrained myself. Now I will cry out like a travailing woman. I will both gasp and pant.
verses.ct: "I have kept silent for a long time. I held myself back and said nothing. But now I will cry out like a woman in labor, gasping and panting for breath.

verses.kjv: I will make waste mountains and hills, and dry up all their herbs; and I will make the rivers islands, and I will dry up the pools.
verses.web: I will destroy mountains and hills, and dry up all their herbs. I will make the rivers islands, and will dry up the pools.
verses.ct: I will lay waste to mountains and hills and dry up every plant growing on them. I will turn rivers into dry land and drain every pool.

verses.kjv: And I will bring the blind by a way that they knew not; I will lead them in paths that they have not known: I will make darkness light before them, and crooked things straight. These things will I do unto them, and not forsake them.
verses.web: I will bring the blind by a way that they don’t know. I will lead them in paths that they don’t know. I will make darkness light before them, and crooked places straight. I will do these things, and I will not forsake them.
verses.ct: I will lead the blind along roads they've never traveled. I will guide them down paths they've never known. I will turn their darkness into light and make their rough paths smooth. These are the things I will do for them — I will never abandon them.

verses.kjv: They shall be turned back, they shall be greatly ashamed, that trust in graven images, that say to the molten images, Ye are our gods.
verses.web: “Those who trust in engraved images, who tell molten images, ‘You are our gods,’ will be turned back. They will be utterly disappointed.
verses.ct: But those who trust in carved idols, who say to their metal images, 'You are our gods' — they will be driven back in utter shame."

verses.kjv: Hear, ye deaf; and look, ye blind, that ye may see.
verses.web: “Hear, you deaf, and look, you blind, that you may see.
verses.ct: "Listen, you who are deaf! Open your eyes, you who are blind, so that you can see!

verses.kjv: Who is blind, but my servant? or deaf, as my messenger that I sent? who is blind as he that is perfect, and blind as the LORD’s servant?
verses.web: Who is blind, but my servant? Or who is as deaf as my messenger whom I send? Who is as blind as he who is at peace, and as blind as LORD’s servant?
verses.ct: Who is more blind than my own servant? Who is more deaf than the messenger I send? Who is as blind as the one I made my partner, as blind as the LORD's own servant?

verses.kjv: Seeing many things, but thou observest not; opening the ears, but he heareth not.
verses.web: You see many things, but don’t observe. His ears are open, but he doesn’t listen.
verses.ct: You've seen so many things, but you don't pay attention. Your ears are wide open, but you don't listen."

verses.kjv: The LORD is well pleased for his righteousness’ sake; he will magnify the law, and make it honourable.
verses.web: It pleased LORD, for his righteousness’ sake, to magnify the law and make it honorable.
verses.ct: It pleased the LORD, because of his righteousness, to make his law great and glorious.

verses.kjv: But this is a people robbed and spoiled; they are all of them snared in holes, and they are hid in prison houses: they are for a prey, and none delivereth; for a spoil, and none saith, Restore.
verses.web: But this is a robbed and plundered people. All of them are snared in holes, and they are hidden in prisons. They have become captives, and no one delivers, and a plunder, and no one says, ‘Restore them!’
verses.ct: But instead, this is a people who have been robbed and plundered. They are all trapped in pits and locked away in prisons. They've become easy prey with no one to rescue them, carried off as plunder with no one demanding, "Give them back!"

verses.kjv: Who among you will give ear to this? who will hearken and hear for the time to come?
verses.web: Who is there among you who will give ear to this? Who will listen and hear for the time to come?
verses.ct: Which of you will pay attention to this? Who among you will stop and listen, starting right now?

verses.kjv: Who gave Jacob for a spoil, and Israel to the robbers? did not the LORD, he against whom we have sinned? for they would not walk in his ways, neither were they obedient unto his law.
verses.web: Who gave Jacob as plunder, and Israel to the robbers? Didn’t LORD, he against whom we have sinned? For they would not walk in his ways, and they disobeyed his law.
verses.ct: Who handed Jacob over to be plundered? Who gave Israel to the looters? Wasn't it the LORD — the one we sinned against? They refused to follow his ways, and they disobeyed his law.

verses.kjv: Therefore he hath poured upon him the fury of his anger, and the strength of battle: and it hath set him on fire round about, yet he knew not; and it burned him, yet he laid it not to heart.
verses.web: Therefore he poured the fierceness of his anger on him, and the strength of battle. It set him on fire all around, but he didn’t know. It burned him, but he didn’t take it to heart.”
verses.ct: So he poured out the heat of his anger on them and unleashed the violence of war against them. It set them on fire from every side, but they didn't understand. It burned them, but they still didn't take it to heart."
